column6: Social and Political impacts likey to improve in 12 months
column7: Social and Political impacts unlikey to improve in 12 months

column3: Countries/leaders are forcing people into isolation and quarantine centers.
People with positive cases are quarantining with people who test negative in quarantine centers in multiple countries.
Many leaders allow security/military forces to act violently on people who break quarantine.
Israel, the UK, and the US are leading in vaccine rollout.
Japan lacking in supplies and equipment to administer vaccines quickly and efficiently.
Countries relying on the AstraZeneca vaccine have a slower vaccine rollout.
Many leaders and media outlets spread a large amount of narratives regarding the coronavirus globally.
Princeton found 5,000 independent misinformation narratives spread by governments and news outlets in over 80 countries.
20% of people in Africa said they would not take the vaccine because they fear the COVID vaccine is less safe compared to other vaccines.
Africa lacking vaccinations supllies - the majority of shipments they receive have the AstraZeneca brand.
In several countries, journalists experience violence for reporting on COVID-19 and countries' disinformation campaigns.
Protesters have been subject to violence and/or  killed in at least 18 countries for protesting against COVID guidelines or lack there of.
Authorities in 51 countries have regulated and adopted COVID guidelines to prevent the spread of COVID
Authorities and leaders in many countries have damaged public trust in their government due to civilian violence and withholding information about COVID-19 to the public.
Tanzania has not reported positive COVID cases and deaths since May 2020, and is withholding information,
